column5: this is a interesting but disturbing article, definetly going to keep a close eye on this one  http://ca.news.yahoo.com/scientists-tiny-plastic-particles-lake-michigan-lake-ontario-131624366.html

http://www.19actionnews.com/story/23294768/strongsville-company-to-pay-more-than-330000-in-fish-kill-case  Kind of sick what ends up in our drinking water? Rocky River runs right into Lake Erie on the western edge of Cleveland. It is or was also one of the rivers used for trout stocking.
Isn't it amazing what industry makes us put into our bodies! I wonder what percentage of that plastic doesn't get spit out when we rinse after brushing our teeth and is then consumed?
It was reported that the companies using these particles will cease using them in 2017.
